intro: Dombeya sahatavyensis, commonly known as the Malagasy dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, forested areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
